page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF THE BLOCK
page.content: The south western corner of the block contains heavy{residential}development which has occurred over the last 20 years and which is continuing to encroach into{agricultural areas,}a topic of abiding local controversy. The{airport}cuts deeply into the block and has continued to increase in size on a fairly regular basis in the same 20 years. The{small valleys and {farming areas}exhibit typical Jersey traits: small fields, dairy farming interspersed with crop rotation of the main export vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and cabbages. The{slopes}are cultivated on the south facing side and the northern slopes are deciduous woodland. The{population}travels to work predominantly in the town some 3 miles away. The{beaches}in the south east of the block are very popular with tourists in summer.
